sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Machiavels ghost, as he lately appeared to his deare sons, the moderne projectors divulged for the pretended good of the kingdomes of England, Scotland, and Ireland. Machiavels ghost Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
[30] p.
Printed by J.O. for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shop ..., London : 1641.
In verse and prose. The tract has been ascribed to Thomas Heywood. Cf. BM. Another ed. has title: Machiavel, as he lately appeared, etc. "Printed by authority, in the yeare of grace, 1641" Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
Machiavels ghost, as he lately appeared to his deare sons, the moderne projectors divulged for the pretended good of the kingdomes of England, Scotland, and Ireland. Machiavels ghost Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
[30] p.
Printed by J.O. for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shop ..., London : 1641.
In verse and prose. The tract has been ascribed to Thomas Heywood. Cf. BM. Another ed. has title: Machiavel, as he lately appeared, etc. "Printed by authority, in the yeare of grace, 1641" Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Francis Constable
J.O.
his shop
